title: How to activate my old Verizon phone - Quora

response.answer_text: This depends on what kind of phone you have. Assuming you have an account with Verizon the old 3g Phones are easy to activate. Dial *228 and select the option for activate my phone. It will ask the mobile number and the billing account password. Once it is verified, it will play some music while the phone is being programmed. The phong will power cycle and when it comes back on it will work. If it is a 4g phong it is a bit more complicated. You will need a compatible Verizon SIM (Verizon SIMs are reusable, unlike most other carriers). You will need to provide the IMEI and ICCID (SIM number) to Verizon: Via My Verizon onlineBy calling Verizon Customer Service from a different phoneBy visiting a Verizon store.

Well this is an open question. You didn't mention whether you are still on Verizon? What model phone is it? If it takes a sim card, and you still have it in another device, and you're still on Verizon, just put the sim into your old phone. But give us some more info.
